page.title: 06FARMING IN BENTHAM
page.content: The sector lies in the Wenning Valley in undulating countryside. The farms are small carrying mostly dairy cattle and sheep. Most pasture land is improved and used for silage and hay. Store cattle and lambs are kept and one battery hen farm lies at Dumb Toms. An Auction Mart is held at Bentham every Wednesday, serving farms within a radius of twenty miles. The Auction building was erected in 1903 but a market has been in existence in Bentham since 1306. Fat sheep and cattle, calves and dairy cattle are sold each Wednesday and special sales of store lambs, breeding sheep and store cattle take place between August and November, mostly on Saturdays. Annual prize shows are held for fat stock and dairy cattle and in June an annual horse fair creates a local spectacle.
